question: You are a code expert, please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Take care to ensure that the code you provide is executable and can be demonstrated. How can one create dynamic web pages using JavaScript to showcase artwork?

checklist.title: Is a proper HTML5 canvas implementation included?
checklist.description: Verify whether the code includes a correctly configured HTML5 canvas element with appropriate dimensions, responsive design considerations, and proper initialization. Check if the canvas context (2D or WebGL) is properly obtained and utilized. Score 0 if canvas is missing, 5 if basic implementation exists, and 10 if it includes advanced features like resolution scaling and browser compatibility solutions.

checklist.title: Are dynamic drawing techniques implemented effectively?
checklist.description: Evaluate the implementation of dynamic drawing techniques such as animation loops (requestAnimationFrame), procedural generation, or interactive elements. Check for smooth frame rates (60fps target), efficient redrawing strategies, and proper timing mechanisms. Deduct 5 points if animations are jerky, 3 points if there's no frame rate control, and 5 points if there are no dynamic elements at all.

checklist.title: Is there proper user interaction with the artwork?
checklist.description: Assess whether the code implements meaningful user interactions such as mouse/touch events, keyboard controls, or gesture recognition that allow users to engage with the artwork. Check for event delegation, proper event listener cleanup, and accessible interaction patterns. Deduct 5 points for missing interaction, 3 points for poor event handling, and 5 points for inaccessible controls.

checklist.title: Does the implementation offer artistic customization options?
checklist.description: Review whether the code provides ways to customize the artwork through parameters, controls, or settings that affect visual appearance. Look for color pickers, sliders for visual parameters, or theme options. Score 0 if no customization exists, 5 points for basic controls, and 10 for comprehensive artistic customization options.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code handles common edge cases (such as browser inconsistencies, window resizing, device orientation changes, etc.) and provides graceful fallbacks or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should handle these edge cases effectively, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Generative art algorithms 2. Physics-based interactions 3. Audio-visual integration 4. AR/VR capabilities). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar drawing functions 2. Unused visual effects or abandoned code paths 3. Overly complex animations that harm performance without adding artistic value. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core artwork display is interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating rendering logic/UI controls/data management), code reusability, and performance optimization techniques. Deduct 5 points if global namespace pollution is found; deduct 5 points if there's excessive code duplication; deduct 5 points if no performance considerations (like debouncing/throttling for intensive operations) exist. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern artistic presentation principles: 1) Clean artwork display area without visual clutter 2) Harmonious control panel design that doesn't distract from the artwork 3) Appropriate use of negative space and composition. Deduct 3 points for each visually distracting element, 5 points for poor artwork framing, and 5 points for chaotic UI layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and responsive?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects and artistic animations conform to human perception: 1) Immediate visual feedback for user interactions 2) Smooth transitions between states or visual changes 3) Appropriate animation timing that enhances rather than detracts from the artwork. Deduct 5 points for laggy responses, 3 points for jarring transitions, and 5 points for animations that distract from appreciating the artwork. The full score is 10 points.
